description:
Ordered delivery from here. Food arrived faster than time quoted from Eat24. Food was hot and fresh. Presentation of the fresh rolls could have been better as they were just wrapped in plastic wrap. 

I would recommend the roti if you have never tried it. A thin soft bread with condensed milk on top. I'm Thailand this is a popular street food and topped with items similar to crepes.
author: Alan H.

description: I only had the mango sticky rice here and unfortunately found it too sweet.  I only ended up finishing the mangos, a bit of the rice and then tossing it away because I couldn't eat it anymore.  :c  The rice had an interesting green hue to it, which was new to me.  Maybe there was a small hint of pandan but not enough to overcome the overbearingly sweet flavor.  Disappointed.
author: Carena N.

description:
Ordering from Hippie Thai is always inconsistent, what you get is always a bit different from last time, which is kind frustrating. They don't seem to follow specific recipes. I've ordered many things from them, but here's a simple example: The fried pumpkin. Sometimes it's more fried, sometimes it's fried but the pumpkin is undercooked, sometimes they give you a lot, but a couple times I was pissed because they only gave me like 4 pieces for the same price. When you order from here you can never be 100% certain as to what you will receive, especially portion wise.

Most of the time the food is good, but it's a gamble.
author: Melle R.

description:
I recently was in the Haight for a work function & chose to refuel at Hippie Thai Street Food afterwards. The Haight has Veganburg which is a unique spot featuring all vegan veggie burgers as Veganburg started in Singapore as their spot in the Haight is their first branch in North America. I wasn't feeling a veggie burger though so decided to check out some Thai food.

Hippie Thai Street Food has Thailand street food. There isn't anything too hippie here except for the fact of being in the Haight which is where the Summer of Love started 50 years ago & the neighborhood where the hippie movement started.  

Hippie Thai Street Food features friendly & efficient service. My server customized my order vegan. I went w/ the lunch combo w/ pad thai w/ fried tofu & veggies, veggie soup, & spring rolls. The portions here are generous & hearty while I was able to finish all mine might be better to stick w/ one of the entrees yet the lunch combo is only slightly more.

The food was tasty w/ a relaxed & casual vibe. Nothing really suggests hippie in the interior atmosphere as there is a cool detailed map of Thailand & a picture of Miley Cyrus w/ some of the staff including my server. I don't know too much about Miley Cyrus's music yet think it is cool that she is vegan & does Ashtanga Vinyasa yoga like I do.

I look forward to returning here!
author: Shane S.

description: Disappointing. I ordered pumpkin curry and it was basically a big bowl of coconut soup with a couple pieces of pumpkin and shrimp. Not enough to actually be considered a meal. Shrimp was way over cooked. We also got the duck stirfry and again, it was a snack size.
author: D M.

description:
Nice vibe! A cool little Thai spot on Haight I'd definitely recommend if you're in the area. Has a really cool, trendy vibe to it and a very wide selection on food. 

Started off with a Thai iced coffee which was refreshing and delicious. Moved on the the pad see ew noodles, panang curry and pad cha talay (seafood dish). Pad see ew and panang curry were solid. Good flavor and a decent serving. The pad cha talay was probably my favorite. I liked the sauce and how well the squid was cooked.

Things came out a little slow, but it seemed they were quite flooded with take out orders. Didn't look that busy seating wise, but their was always someone coming through the doors to pick up Ann order. 

Looks like they have good weekday lunch specials, so I'll definitely come back to try that!
author: Courtney N.

description: Was on the Haight and was looking for some Thai tea boba but no boba came up within the vicinity so I just grabbed a quick Thai tea from here instead. It came out to three and some change and was pretty good will have to try food here next time!
author: Zach H.

description: So this is my second time here. I love the ambience and the music and the food is bomb  the vegan dishes are flavored well and I love the pictures on the food. This is going to be my spot for now on when I'm working in the area. It is small but if it's busy it's worth the wait. They also do delivery and pick up which I love. The location is right by the 7 bus spot in the heart of haight and Ashbury.
author: Elizabeth G.

description:
Found this place randomly after Bay to Breakers. We were a group of 8 looking for food and this place had space. Plus, Thai food sounded pretty good after a morning of sun and people watching :)

I got the pad see ew with beef and shared the Tom Kha soup with a friend. The soup was good, but nothing special. I liked my pad see ew which had good char on it from the wok. I tried some of my friend's pad Thai which seemed off. The sauce was different than what I'm used to. I think it was more sour than normal? My friend added lime, but I feel like it usually doesn't get that sour with other pad thais when you add lime.

I would come back for the pad see ew if I was in the area. They had a good lunch special where you get soup and salad along with an entree and appetizer for $13 but I think it's only on weekdays. My pad see ew was $12 on its own so pretty nice deal!
author: Denise H.

description:
I was here with my best friend's son who goes to USF. He eats here a lot so I said let's go. It's a small place, kind of a dive but clean. The food is exceptional. I had a spin on Pad Thai but with a chow fun type noodle. It was really good. My friend's kid got a fried rice dish which he loved. 

I'd definitely come back again and try the other items on the menu.
author: R K.

description: I only had the garlic noodles here as a snack, and they were definitely more sweet than garlic-y, almost to the point where they tasted like dessert! The portion size was good, quite a lot of food for just $5. I could only eat a few bites though and then had to pour in soy sauce in order to add some flavor and reduce the sweetness. Would recommend trying other items on the menu, since the friends I went with seemed to enjoy the curries and such.
author: Sonia D.

description:
Pretty disappointed with the Thai food here. Came in here and ordered chicken skewers - the waiter actively discouraged me from getting those and insisted I get the satay chicken instead. When it came out (in under 2 mins) it was extremely dry and cold- clearly someone else had ordered this dish before and cancelled it. It was truly terrible. 
He also forgot my jasmine rice. 2 stars for having fresh coconut.
author: Sam M.

description: After a long day of dragging the kids through the city we decided to stroll up to haight to find some eats. This place looked great from the outside and we were not disappointed!! Quaint place, such friendly staff and a great menu. Everything we ordered was delicious! Kids had chicken satay and we had noodle dishes. They even customized one of the dishes to avoid pork and include shrimp. They had an assortment of hot sauces and jalapeños to add to the dishes too. Even our picky kid eaters gave it two thumbs up.
author: Laurie C.

description: Stopped here for lunch while taking a touristy stroll down Haight. Good food - fast & fresh. I had the pad Thai with tofu. Friendly service.
author: L M.

description:
Quick and authentic.  Open later than most places on the Haight.  The place looks family run and the keep the place nice and clean.  Oh and I forgot...it's street food authentic and delicious too.
Be not afraid of the spice!
author: Kashif M.

description: This Thai restaurant is delicious! Really cool ambience- plus hearing the serves and cooks speak the Thai language. I had a Thai tea- always a must have. And some shrimp glass noodle stir fry. Shrimp cooked perfectly and just overall thoroughly enjoyed. Definitely recommend.
author: J H.

description:
I've been coming here for two years now. Even after moving away, this is one of the spots I have to hit whenever I come back. I'm half Thai and grew up in Chiang Mai, and this is my favorite Thai place in SF. The quality and authenticity is unbeatable, and for such good prices! Everything I've ever ordered has been good, but their crown jewel is the glass noodles with shrimp in clay pot. I haven't found a place that makes that dish as well as Hippie Thai in the USA yet. The Khao Soi is also very good, as is the larb and Sai ua. Service is amazing and the waiters are so friendly. 

I don't understand how this place only has three stars right now! Hawker fare is probably as authentic, but they only serve northern or northeastern dishes and are quite a bit pricier. Imm is also as authentic, but it's all the way in Berkeley and the menu is much more limited than here. Can't think of another place I'd give #1 Thai place in SF award to.
author: Reed T.

description: This place wasn't too shabby. A bit on the higher price side but we both ordered the lunch special. The spring roll was delicious and I enjoyed the soup. The pad thai was ok. Not bad but not amazing. Granted I  am very picky with my pad thai and ya it was ok.
author: Heather S.

description: The pad see ew was terrible. Was burnt and had weird texture from the cooking pan. First time that a place has screwed up a pad see ew....
author: Kaya D.

description:
I give this place 3 stars because their food is delicious. However, do not expect a great level of service. 

For my daughter's birthday celebration with friends, I booked a table 2 weeks in advance. When they arrived 5 minutes before their reservation, they were told there was no table waiting for them and they ended up waiting 30 minutes for a table. If you aren't going to honor reservations, then why take them? They had gone to another destination (Hall of Mirrors) before and could have spent more time there rather than waiting for a table. Very frustrating, especially since I made sure they knew it was a birthday when I placed the reservation. 

They did come home with leftovers and typically when you order something and it comes with a sauce, you usually get sauce with it when it is in the to-go bag. Not here. Our veggie spring rolls were sauceless and therefore not that tasty. However, luckily the other items were very tasty otherwise they would be getting one star.
author: Lisa H.

description: Hippie Thai Street Food is a great one stop location. I was here with a couple of friends and we did a family style dinner. We ordered the Pad Thai, Vegan Spring Roll, Green Chicken Curry, and a shrimp stir-fry. I was overall impressed. Will take my friends here again. :D
author: Danny V.

description: Painfully mediocre-at-best. I like to support my local restaurants but they just need to step it up here. The tiniest bit of effort in the food quality could bring this place up several notches. I've never experienced anything here that's actually *bad*, but every time I'm chowing down I just kind of roll my eyes and wonder why I'm paying when it's merely sustinence, not enjoyment.
author: Joe D.

description: Wow! I ordered their green curry, and I felt like the food just took me to Thailand! You can choose wether you want pork/seafood/beef/vegtables and many more. I highly recommend that you try this when you're near the area or when you're craving for some Thai food!! Peace and Love!
author: Joseph Christian G.

description: Delicious vegetarian pumpkin curry and pad-see-ew.  Great flavor, big portions and good price. Hard to find in SF.  And very friendly waitresses . Perfect late night spot!
author: Mel A.

description:
Authentic Thai Food in SF!

My friends and I have spent the last couple years exploring Thai food all over SF. We're picky. Hippie Thai stands out for having authentic, unpretentious dishes that always hit the spot!

One of our favorites is the clay pot Goong Ob Woon Sen glass noodles. We haven't found this central Thai dish done well in any other spot in the city and I would definitely recommend it for any pork belly and shrimp lovers.  
Another great dish is their Khao Soi. Anyone who has been to Chiang Mai has probably fallen in love with this golden curry and Hippie Thai does it right! Try it out. The mixture of soft and crunchy egg noodles in turmeric-laced coconut soup is amazing on chilly SF nights. We usually steer clear of old standards like Pad Thai, but if you're craving that, we can also say that their Pad Thai is also surprisingly delicious! Really I would eat anything on that menu. 

The service here is fast and all the wait staff are very accommodating, even when we drop by with a big group (because we always want to take our friends there). Thanks, Hippie Thai! We'll be back.
author: Celine B.

description: Excellent food! Their peanut sauce is amazing!!! We were both very happy that we ended up picking this place to eat considering all of the options on Haight.
author: Star B.

description:
Ordered delivery via Grubhub.

Delivery was fast. Food was bad. Very very bland.

Red curry didn't have the faintest hint of coconut milk and was way too watery.

Hard pass.
author: Russ S.

description: So yummy!! Walked by while shopping on Haight, and I'm so happy we went in! We ordered Thai ice tea, the roti, beef pad kee mao, and kao moo dang & moo krob. Everything tasted great! Servers were also very nice. Would definitely come again!
author: Michelle T.

description: The food here is mediocre, under seasoned, and expensive. All the opposite of what proper Thai food should be. There's just not much else to say. I live around the corner and would rather walk down the street where there are better places. Just don't bother.
author: Mogan S.

description: The food is delicious. It is. I don't know what's up with these stuck up Bay Area people who think because they've been to Thailand twice, they know how Thai food should taste. I've been here a number of times and each time, I'm pleased. The one server guy is always super kind, and the food comes out hot and flavorful. Get a Thai tea, it's delicious. The pad kee mao is great too.
author: Arielle W.

description: I love Thai food. I tried my first coconut soup in Thailand in a very casual place. When I was having dinner in Hippie Thai Street Food, I felt for a moment that I was in that place back in Thailand a few years ago. Ingredients are really fresh, taste is genuinely Thai, they have a few types of Thai beer and the bill was a pleasant surprise. Good value for money, way to go!
author: Yev R.

description:
Hippie Thai? More like Ditzy Thai. They had only five customers at three tables on a Monday night, yet they still managed to forget our order of roti, which finally arrived 5 minutes before we finished our dinner. Lame.

Honestly, I'd have been more tolerant of the bad service if the food were better, but alas. The pork with string beans came with lots of bell peppers and carrots - none of which were mentioned on the menu. And it wasn't spicy at all, despite my request to make it extra hot.

The green curry dish was on par, but only in comparison.

I really wanted to root for this place, since it's new, and it's hard running a small business. But they were just disappointing.
author: Kristen S.

description: Affordable Thai food. Servers are kind. Wish the to-go portions were a little bigger.
author: John D.

description: I love Thai food but this place kinda sucked. I had to ask my server three times for water before she finally brought it. My boyfriends red shrimp curry was pretty good. The fresh shrimp rolls could've been better for 11 dollars. My eggplant dish was decent but I've had better eggplant dishes. The Thai tea was not good as the tea seemed over done. Everything was over priced. I understand it's on haight street in San Fran but still....way over priced for mediocre cheap food. The chairs don't have backs to them, they are more like stools. They weren't terribly uncomfortable but I do prefer chairs when I'm sitting down paying that price for dinner. I won't be coming back.
author: Sue F.

description: Tried to use the bathroom before ordering. They wouldn't let me and I had to pee so I left. Used to be an amazing place and have great food. Their customer service is obviously crap and the staff can't handle the few tables they have. Rip to the bombest Thai on haight
author: Nicolette T.

description: Food was delish!  Service was great, very accommodating folks!  We'll be back!  I had the pumpkin Thai Curry with chicken and Mom and sis had Penang curry with shrimp.  All were great!
author: Mary M.

description: Disappointing. Pad se ew dry (no sauce), "tendon soup with extra tendon" had no tendon and the broth was inedible. We had to throw the whole order out.
author: Amy T.

description: Food is below standards - apart from low quality ingredients, the sauce was thoughtless and I could taste residuals from other dishes, most likely as a result from not properly sanitizing the cookware between cooking different entrees.
author: Suzanne H.

description: Great Thai food in a funky setting.  Our server was very nice and energetic.  To increase the cool factor, there was some shoot being setup right outside the restaurant while we ate.
author: Kyle F.

description: I think this place is under rated. It has a cute environment, quick and nice staff. The food is yummy too. I haven't gotten anything that hasn't been good! Love their pad Thai, or seafood noodle soup. Great fried rice or meat dishes. I go every week and have yet to have a bad experience!
author: Jenny W.

description: I like this place because I love hippies, Haight St., and Thai. I ordered green curry with chicken, and how hard is it to make that so that it's edible?(Not that hard). I scarfed down my dish. I held back on getting a Thai iced tea...maybe another time.
author: Denise C.

description:
I think this place used to be a different place whenever i pass this place before it change it names to Hippie Thai. Came here for a late lunch. Small place. Has open kitchen. There were only 2 other customers when i came to have lunch here.

I Got their beef noodle soup. $10 before tax.
Brother got pad thai for $10
Average/a little more expensive than same thai restaurants

Foods come our hot which is a good thing. They give you decent amount of food when you order. Thought their food were good enough to get you satisfied with thai food

Since it wasnt busy restaurant at the time i came, the food came out quick
author: Julie N.

description:
So I was a little shocked to read the reviews after having eaten here, because my boyfriend and I agreed our meal here was some of the best casual-type Thai food we've had in the city. We ordered the one of the combo "lunch boxes" that came with chicken green curry, fried tofu and mixed vegetables, chicken pad Thai, and rice and really enjoyed everything we got. The green curry had a nice amount of heat to it (noticeable, but not the make you cry and sweat level) and had delicious pieces of eggplant in it. That was our favorite, but the other two dishes were tasty and fresh as well. The green tea that came with the dishes was not particularly great, but since it came with the meal (which was a really sizable portion for two people -we ended up being stuffed and I took some pad Thai home for later-and came to $25) I wasn't too disappointed.  

Price wise, I don't think it's too different from other nearby Thai places that I have liked significantly less.  We came on a Tuesday night around 7 pm and were served very quickly and politely. The bathroom was out of order, which was a bit annoying because I wasn't able to wash my hands before eating. So a star off for that and the subpar green tea.
author: Anna D.

description: I only had one dish, chicken curry in puff pastry with peanut sauce. It did not seem to have any chicken in it, but the favor was great.
author: Felicia C.

description:
I've been to many Thai restaurants and I have to say the food here is great every time i go. My favorite dish is their cashew chicken which comes with rice and veggies. I typically order mango stick rice to go along with it which is what drew me in to the place my first time going; there was a picture on the window from the street view. The 3 stars has nothing to do with the food but the service needs some work. Seriously!! It gets even worse when it's very busy which is easy given how quaint the place is. I was given a menu one time when it was busy and had a question about a few dishes and the waitress kept leaving and telling me to just look it over and she would be back after seating, serving and cleaning after other patrons. Granted this waitress was buzzing around doing many roles and trying not to miss any business opportunities as she place as many people as she could in the small space. 

There was a male there that I see often when I'm there just standing by the area where the chefs put the food out to hand her the food and make sure the order were correct but other than that the one waitress this particular time of day was doing all other roles alone. In short, they needed more staff or the male there could have done more to assist her. 

The bathrooms could use some updating but it was clean the one time I needed to use it out of the 6 or so times I've been there. Few other things...I think it's unique that they give you a metal cup to drink water out of. There is not much to the decor but I'm there to eat good food so I don't mind. It's pretty true to a few restaurants I went to while in Thailand.
author: Tanisha S.

description:
Came here for lunch on Sunday with friends. The decor was cute but the food was mediocre. I ordered the Pad Kee Mao with chicken. It wasn't bad, but it just wasn't that good either. I can't exactly pinpoint what about it wasn't great, but Marnee Thai definitely does it better. My friend had the yellow curry (which I sampled)  which turned out kind of watery and didnt taste authentic. My other friend ordered a chicken dish which he thoroughly enjoyed so perhaps their rice plates are more promising. 

The server was friendly and attentive and the food came out quickly, but there weren't many other customers at the time that we were there. Not sure how they are when it is busy. 

Best part of my meal was the young coconut juice straight out of a coconut! Oh and they also have Thai beer here if that's your thing. Probably won't be back here unless my friends want it.
author: Brenda L.

description:
It is another good Thai food to try on haight st whose menu accumulate of famous Thai street food for example tom yum noodle and duck noodle in authentic Thai taste!!! Really enjoy the taste

The decorations inside was very Indy. Staff is friendly and helpful.
author: Pat R.

description:
I have been a customer of best of Thai noodle house ( or whatever the previous title was) for around 6 or 7 years..  loved the place.  Then comes "hippie" thai...
They have been mediocre at best... but today I go about 40 minutes before close... when i recieve my food, about 20 min before close, they were quick to dismiss me and "shoo" me away from the condiment tray... assuring me that I had everything I needed and, as they assume, in the proper portions in their wasteful plastic containers they forced upon me... I just wanted a bit more chili powder than they figured I wanted, and some crushed peanuts to top my rice nothing more... real hippies wouldn't waste all those ingredients and ask those plastic containers... just saying.
author: Bryan V.

description:
My dinner always here! If you like thaifood in thai street style,here is your place. Khao soi gai and thai herbal tea are super perfect match in my rainy cold day . Curry is so good tho, beef salad, and chicken skewers. 
 The herbal choices dish recommendation are : goong ob woonsen , pad cha talay 
Drink: thai ice t, singha and thai herbal tea
author: Chu O.

description: Not many spices used in this dish, classic taste for pad see ew, used lots of chilli paste for flavor (which I don't mind) price is decent for portions. Iced Thai coffee is amazing.
author: Monica M.

description:
This is the worst thai restaurant I've ever been too, I'm not eating/paying for this, flavorless, vermicelli noodle for pad Thai, don't cook it spicy, never have I refused to pay for food, but this is gonna be a first.

13$?? 

What are the good reviews for?
author: Austin J.

description: The food's really delicious, so many flavors in each dish. My husband ordered Kow Moo Dang w/ Moo Krob (BBQ pork, pork belly and chinese sausage). I love spicy thai food, so I ordered their Pad Prik Khing w/ beef and topped w/ fried egg. Each spoon full is like an explosion of flavors in your mouth, UMAMI..!! We just can't stop eating, that's how good it is. So glad we tried this place, because they are now my fave must-go-to thai food places. And oh, just to let you know, their portions are huge!!! Don't forget to order thai iced tea and crispy fried egg rolls. Yelpers, try not to read the bad comments. Their staff are very sweet and friendly...
author: Ava T.

description: Stopped in after a long afternoon of walking around The Haight. I was thinking some soup sounded good since it was a little chilly out (hey I'm from Vegas so anything under 80 degrees is cold to me). Was immediately seated & given water by a young gentleman. The menu featured quite a few main courses and a nice variety of soups. I settled on #30 Kuay Tiew Tom Yum. Yowza it was spicy!  Not being experienced in Thai food I didn't realize how hot it would be. The flavor was excellent and everything was very fresh. My waiter came over several times to refill my water (a BIG thank you!). I enjoyed my soup and would order it again just not as spicy. Service was on point, food was served quickly and tasted good. This place is solid.
author: Kimberly D.

description:
What has happened to this place?  This had been a go-to place when we did not want to cook and did not to deal with parking, etc. as it is nearby.  We always order crab fried rice and red curry with beef.  The crab fried rice did not seem to have any crab and when complained and it came back with supposedly more crab, it was still bland and could not find the crab.  The red curry was watery and lacked spice.  The crab fried rice used to have a bunch on the top. And the curry used to have some heat and not watery.

Did they change cooks?

It has lost its place as a "go-to" joint.
author: Ross T.

description:
Where is GORDON RAMSEY
GORDON come and fix up the dishes of this place
Whenever asian foods go fusion they become confusion
It looks and tastes unappetizing
GORDON please come and clean up their acts
author: Chef C.

description:
Best of Thai, Hippie Thai's predecessor, was not the best Thai food in town. But it was cheap and open late, many dishes were under $10. When I saw the place had re-opened as Hippie Thai, I was kind of excited to try it out, hoping for better quality and a decent lunch spot in the Haight.

Today I decided to, and regret to inform that it is not worth it.

-Ordered a hot tea which was $1.50, it was very weak tea, on par with tea that is offered complimentary at some restaurants. My server couldn't even tell me what sort of tea it was, other than being herbal.

-Portions are small for what you pay for. Some dinner places can get away with charging $10 for curry that doesn't include rice if it's fine dining, high quality, etc. With a name like "Hippie Thai", you're coming off more as a casual lunch spot, and not including rice with a small portion of $10 curry is heinous.

-I ordered sticky rice to accompany my yellow curry. The curry itself was actually pretty good, creamy and mildly spicey, but the rice was terrible. Not sure if "sticky" was the right word to describe it, perhaps "incredibly chewy, tough, and dry" would have worked better. 

I paid $15 for the picture you see below, not including tip.

Will not be back.
author: Megan D.

description: Delicious and wholesome. The Basil and lemongrass really hit the spot for me. OMG, their Roti bread is crunchy and delicious! I'd definitely go back when I'm in Haight St again
author: Elia C.

description: Plainly mediocre. The chicken with peanut sauce was something I could buy from a grocery store and microwave. The sauce was non-offensive and bland, the chicken was a bit dry and tasteless and the veggies were a little mushy. The staff was very friendly and got my food out fast so that was a plus.
author: Roff S.

description: I eat here a lot, because Hippie Thai, is right down the street from my house. The Tom Yum and Tom Kha are really good. The portions are generous, and the staff are super nice. Haight St. isn't know for its food. I'm glad this place is here.
author: John D.

description: This was the best Thai food I have had in a long time. The atmosphere is very nice and the food is to die for. They have really authentic Thai food and the service is great. The waiters always uses are always there to help you when you need it and the location is great because it's on the Haight
author: Jameka W.

description: Service was so poor.we ordered so many dishes like chicken dishes and noodles,there was a smell in chicken dishes but the Thai ice tea was so good excellent.next time I will go there to have Thai ice tea only ............
author: Surendra K.

description: We came for the wings and it was totally worth it.  I also had fresh coconut water which is rare to find.  We will be back again.
author: Vanessa L.

description:
A bit of a rip off price-wise.  There has been a *lot* of price creep for dishes that are pretty cheap to make (e.g. pad see ew that's 70% rice noodle).  

The food itself is average, and can be a little hit or miss as to whether it's really oily or not...I'm now debating whether I should remove a star. 

The atmosphere isn't a place where you want to hang out and linger. 

Yeah, I guess I'm surprised they are getting away with charging what they are for average Thai food in a place with a chilly, pretty bare bones and not particularly comfy interior.
author: Lauren C.

description: The veggie soup noodle was incredible!!! So lemony and garlicy and super healthy and the veggies were cooked just right so they were just crunchy enough - not mushy. Had to drink every drop of the soup. Highly recommend!
author: Dyne S.

description: The #41 & #42 are so delicious!! It was really great Thai food! The service was very fast and the gentleman was very nice! The price was also very reasonable! Love the atmosphere!.  Very nice!
author: Sam H.

description:
This was the worst food I had in SF!! 

I ordered a crab cake and it was disgusting.  My friend ordered a beef stew and didn't eat much of it.

The location, fresh spring rolls and Thai iced tea were the only things this place had going for it.  

I'd like to see that place be more healthy and sustainable as well.  Everything was so cheap and the prices were pretty high.
author: Aja N.

description:
I came here with my in laws and 8 month old son*: 

Pad Thai, green curry and a really spicy green bean and chicken dish! The food was really good and everyone enjoyed their meals including. Service was quick but the server wasn't the least bit friendly, not a single smile the whole time.

*FYI there is no baby change here, the toilet is like it has been imported straight from Thailand!  Well maybe not quite the bad but not far off! My mother in law had to sit on the toilet while I changed the baby on her knee! Not ideal situation or hygienic!
author: Jenna B.

description: You will come down with diabetes type 2 from this place. Not one dish is without massive amounts of sugar...Even the rice tasted like a pile of skittles. The server seems annoyed.
author: Flim S.

description: I gotta say their papaya salad with tofu was awesome. To me, a great papaya salad dish, I have to be able to smell all of the aroma of the ingredients when it's served. And they did it here. Also it was my first time having it with tofu and yes I liked it. We ordered pad kee mow and koa loua ( special order) and none was disappointed. The decorations made me feel like I was eating at a small restaurant or street food booth in Thailand. Service was great too. Very nice people. Can't wait to come back to.
author: Puangphet Y.

description:
I ordered delivery from here, and since it was so close to my home, I reluctantly decided this was the place to get Thai food from. I had eaten there once before in store and the food was just meh. Everything in the restaurant just seemed so dirty though, it did not make me want to come and dine in again (but maybe that's just the ambience of Haight in general). 

Right when I placed my order through Eat24, I got a phone call from the restaurant. The person from the restaurant remarked that my directions for the driver to walk a minute down this big drive way to hand me my food was too complicated and that I should go and grab the food from him. But here's how he put it "Yeah, the driver is not going to come into the building. He's gonna park outside and you go get it. OK?" I was slightly confused but agreed THEN HE ADDED "Oh and you need to tip him in cash. Tip him ok?" And I was appalled. It's one thing to remind a customer to tip, it's common courtesy of course I would tip, but to say it in such a demanding tone makes me never ever want to order or eat here again. And the fact that I have to go and get the food from him, making his job easier does not want me to tip him any more. I would rather pay for extra to have any other Thai restaurant come deliver for me. When the driver got here, I did not hear my phone but I saw that he called 5 times (4 minutes ago) and when I called him back, he was screaming at me to come get my food because he was busy and sounded really irritated even though I told him I was on my way. And when I gave him a tip he added "Wow, that's it?? Next time come and pick it up at the restaurant." They really need to work on their customer service, especially since it is a new restaurant and is not very established compared to others like King of Thai or Osha. I'm telling all my friends to never come back here.
author: M T.

description:
This place barely is eking out a three. I came in group of 5 and we were seated quickly for a Saturday night. Though 3 dishes had something wrong with them, the food was so good and we were comped 10% so that comes out to a three for me.

So the bad:
- Two dishes had significant mistakes
- One dish and a drink were completely forgotten about

But the good:
- The food was delicious
- The Thai ice tea was delicious
- Cheap
- Comped 10%
author: Michail Y.

description:
Excellent food and friendly staff. My son and I got the Pad Thai lunch special while my wife and daughter shared the Tom Yum and a Curry both of which were also quite good.

The place is cozy and reasonable priced.
author: Geoff P.

description: THEY HAVE THE WORST CUSTOMER SERVICE. I ordered delivery of Pad See Ew and the food was so bland I had to pour my bottle of soy sauce on to my noodles. The driver who delivered to me was beyond rude. poor food, WORSE customer service (can't believe that is possible but it is). Please save your money and order food elsewhere. Need a change of attitude!!!!!
author: Vivian K.

description:
Oh god if I could take back my Tom Yum soup or Duck Curry. Service was shotty. They forgot I wanted duck on the side. And when I said something she goes. Oh sorry and walks away. The hell?

As goes for the food. Nothing about both of them jumped at me in anyway. Bland soup. Watery curry. Fail.
author: Ninotchka A.

description: I have eaten at the actual location before and the pad se ew and pad thai my friend & I ordered was really good. So today, I decided to get the pad se ew with tofu & vegetables ($11) and a pad thai with chicken ($11) delivered to me. The pad se ew with tofu & vegetables came with a few pieces of broccoli, some napa cabbage, carrots, fried tofu, some scrambled egg, and big pieces of noodles. And the pad thai with chicken came with chicken, thin noodle, a lime, crushed peanuts, fried tofu, and bean sprouts. The delivery arrived within 40 minutes and utensils and napkins were provided, which is a plus. However, the pad se ew and pad thai were not great at all. Both dishes were lacking in flavor and sauce. It was a major disappointment.
author: Victoria H.

description: Every time I order here I ask for a dish to be made vegan (no fish sauce, oyster sauce or egg, etc) and they tell me that different items can be made vegan and not vegan! One time they said all curries were vegan and they never used fish sauce (but salt instead) and the next time I ordered they said they had fish sauce and could not be veganized. I don't know what to trust!
author: Kayla W.

description:
I live in the upper Haight and have been a regular here since they took over from Crescent City in the late '90's. I have always liked their curries, and I would normally give them a 5 star review. At least once a week for 20 years once meant something.

But, the last three times I have come in to order take-out (around 9 PM) in the last two weeks, the restaurant is packed with asian tourists on a bus tour. Your are told that take out will need about 45 minutes. So this restaurant I once liked has become a pit stop on a cheap tourist tour. I hope the understand that when their tourist season ends, their regulars, who paid the rent for 20 years, are NOT coming back.
author: Steven B.

description: They Kept changing the rules, the prices and their attitude is the worst. I know they are located in Haight and named hippie thai but even hippies and homeless who lives on street have more manners and considerations than their management. I never write a reviews here but the last thing I want is to dine or order delivery ever again.
author: Edward T.

description:
I came to this venue a total of three times. I'm completely unimpressed by the level of service from my last visit, and I'm pretty laid back and easy going as a restaurant patron, because they are people too. The staff was rude as HELL, my dinner was subpar - why the hell am I paying extra for Prawns in my Pad Thai only to get three? I could've spent LESS by getting chicken and getting more of it. Cheapasses. I waited almost 10 minutes for my check, which was *thrown* on my table in a Frisbee...

There are PLENTY of other Thai places in San Francisco. I'll go to them in the future. I'll give them one star for the food actually being decent - and I don't have a choice to go lower.
author: Adrian W.

description: My pad kee mao was extremely oily. :( I also asked  for it to be spicy and it wasn't spicy at all. The red curry was okay. The service wasn't necessarily bad but it also wasn't good. I got my food to go and the waitress forgot to give me utensils and when I asked for them she just stands by the register and doesn't move from where she is and points to a corner and says "they're right there." Umm okay. There's also a lot of homeless people in the area asking for money but I mean it is on Haight. Probably won't return.
author: Andrea R.

description: Love this place! Larb Ped is sooo good. Herbal drink is really delicious. Some real gems here that you won't get anywhere else. House special noodles are really good too.
author: K N.

description:
I'll start off with the good parts: the service and the decor. The wait staff was really friendly and welcoming and I really liked the decor. Unfortunately, they don't make up for the lackluster food.

I ordered the duck over rice and the rice was cold. I generally prefer warm rice over hot rice anyway, but this was straight up cold. I'm probably being a bit harsh with this review, but come on, how hard is it to serve hot rice?

I may give this place another shot, but considering how many actually good Thai places there are in the city, it won't be for a long while.
author: Ty L.

description:
Hipper Thai Street Food is a new, clean/updated Thai restaurant in the heart of the Haight. 

 I ordered the Tofu Pad Kee Mao. The food came out quickly and tasted fresh. The dish wasn't very spicy but had great flavor. 

The service match the quality of the cooking. We felt welcomed and our business appreciated.
author: Caroline L.

description: One of my to go place for Thai food. Super convenient, the restaurant close really late so that's super convenient. The staff are friendly. The good.
author: Tan D.

description:
This restaurant used to be Best of Thai, but has recently received a facelift to become Hippie Thai. I really like Thai food and frequent the Haight for lunch. Best of Thai was my last ditch resort in case my preferred Thai spots weren't open. 

I was hoping the facelift would bring tastier food, but I actually think it is getting worse. As a matter of fact, I've taken about 4 bites of my pad thai and am considering throwing it in the trash. The Thai iced tea I ordered, which is something I usually down within minutes, hit the trash can halfway through. I really wanted to like it, but it was cream heavy and lacked flavor. I just couldn't justify the calories. 

Not only is my pad thai lifeless with no flavor, it cost me 2 bucks more for an order of pad thai and Thai iced tea than any other Thai spot in the Haight!

I tried one more bite of my meal and have decided it isn't worth eating. I eat a LOT of Thai food and this is quite possibly the worst representation I have had in the past several years. 

DO NOT waste your time eating here when there are much better Thai restaurants in the Haight.
author: Russell S.

description: Very mediocre. I ordered the tom yum soup. It was literally just overcooked chicken, mushrooms, and two giant chunks of underripe tomato. The broth was kind of sweet which wasn't a good choice. It seems like they use poor quality ingredients and don't put much care into preparation either. Not cheap for what you get.
author: Sara S.

description:
The service here is pretty appalling. I've been here three times now. One time I was ignored for a while before I gave up and left. Another time I noticed I was charged for an item that I didn't order, and they argued with me telling me that I did. On my last visit I didn't receive the correct change on my bill. The food is decent for what it is. They should try to get some competent waitstaff.

Be sure to double check your bill and count your change.
author: Kevin O.

description: Super tasty. It was completely empty when I came in around 1PM. I was hesitant to try it out since the reviews didn't look too good. But the food was amazing. I'm picky about Thai food and I got the green curry with veggies/tofu. My friend got vegetarian pad see ew (I think). Both dishes were super tasty and well priced. Will be back again.
author: Tasha B.

description:
Was really happy to try this new spot. 

I was craving pad thai and HSFT had great early hours which could assist in satiating my fiendish craving. My experience was a 3 stars (non deflected btw, I'll be back) really due to a crabby/bitchy waitstaff and not a sloppy-tamarind-more wet pad thai. 

Portions are big and affordable, great casual lunch spot to go alone or grab take out. Just to note the pad thai was underwhelming simply due to me being used to different prep. So that said, I won't come back for that dish, but I will try others.
author: Sloane T.

description:
Please bring back old fried tofu appetizer! And the peanut sauce!

The new fried tofu is more like tempura and the dish no longer comes with peanut sauce. If you get an extra peanut sauce, it no longer has the rich flavor and consistency of the previous sauce.
author: Alex T.

description: I've been going here regularly since 2008 and was seriously my favorite Thai food joint ever when it was BOT Noodle. Since the new ownership, bad name change (still trying to do the hippie thing with higher prices on Haight on 2017?!), and higher prices, it still remained pretty good (although still not good as BOT Noodle). But, living out of state, I hadn't been here in 6 months so gave it another try. I had the chicken eggplant basil rice dish. The chicken was dry, bland and undercooked. The eggplant was completely undercooked. My friend's dish was also bland and no salt. Of the countless times I've been here, this was the first time I've really been let down. The fact that it wasn't as good as before in the last year I've tried it and now just bad is a terrible sign. Luckily I've found a good and cheaper Thai food joint on Polk (but that's a secret). Maybe I'll come back here again in 1/2 year or a year and see if it's back to where it was back in the day or I may not as I don't like the trend o increasing prices and decreasing quality. Sad!
author: Not S.

description: its exactly what its called hippie thai. gourmet homemade thai food generous amount though but if you wanted high class fancy thai food this is not the place. but the portion is large and it doesnt taste too bad id consider coming back pretty good stuff ;)
author: Abigail S.

description: Stopped in after a day of shopping. We ordered pad thai with fried tofu and chicken satay. Everything came out hot and fresh. $20 for both items which is not bad considering the portions are good size.
author: Joanna M.

description:
Seriously THE BEST THAI FOOD around!!
Every dish was expertly created and perfectly executed. The Tom Kah was excellent. Por Pia Thot was so good! The curry noodles and drunken noodles were to die for! Eat here if you get the opportunity, you will not regret it!
author: Rachel H.

description: Worst Thai food .. I never tried  such food before ... I go for 2 star becoz service is good
author: Pramod G.

description: This is a worst Thai restaurant.yesterday I go to the restaurant and I have to order more food duck yellow curry ,egg roll,duck noodles . Every dish I can't like. They're all food have dirty smells . I have to pore experience. I west my money hear .  They're costumer service also poor. They don't ask for us water . We have 5 people but we have just 4 tissues on our table. Just two star for they're beer. I never going back again.
author: Krishna K.

description: Loved this place! Super cool hippy-like interior. The waiter was extremely kind and helpful. The food came out really quickly, too. I got the yellow curry and it was delicious! Definitely would go back.
author: Michelle B.

description:
Was disappointed but only tasted 2 dishes. I think.they have a Chinese chef an the sauces are more Chinese than thai.
The spring rolls were expensive and unremarkable.   I may go back to give it another chance but it failed this time
author: Lamb C.

description: Hippie Thai is by far my favorite place to eat in the city. The vibes are super epic here and the food is incredibly flavorful and perfect. Friendly staff and clean restaurant. Highly recommended. 5 stars.
author: OG H.

description:
4 star just for their calamari alone!

I had their bbq pork/rice dish and it wasn't bad.

The side of roti didn't come with some sort of sweet sauce sadly.

But that calamari tho!
author: Lauren L.

description: We were just walking down haight street looking for a place to eat, and this one seemed inviting. The pad see ew I ordered was pretty good- the prices we reasonable although the service was kinda slow, considering there weren't very many people in the restaurant. Not bad, but I'm going to have to try it a few more times and revisit this review. :)
author: Erin C.

description: So legit! I brought my cousin for her first Thai experience. I could tell she was super hesitant to try it so I just asked her if I could order for us. Because of their fabulous pad thai and yellow curry she's a huge fan. What really made my day though was their warm welcoming nature. We both had small children with us and it's a very small restaurant, however not only did they assist us with getting into the restaurant and to a table that accommodated our high chairs; they were really sweet to our kids. I wish I could give more stars.
author: Jen O.

description: Okay, I only go here because I live on the block. The last handful of times I've been here it's terrible. I ordered a crab rice dish that costed me $15 and it had about three small pieces of crab in it. There was also a hair in it! They've also gotten my order wrong more than once and the food isn't even good. Don't come here!
author: Julia A.

description:
i pull my thai card quite a bit when it comes to a thai restaurant. 

let's talk about pad kaprao kai kaidao (chicken basil with fried egg on top). 
it is something you order at a thai food cart when you really can't think of anything else to order. it is something you get at a school cafeteria. it is a classic. it is comfort. but everybody has their own preference of what it should taste like and what should be in it. 

my version, which is obviously the best one, should just have the meat, the basic, and maybe long beans and nothing else. and it is the version you will get here at hippie thai. and the sauce must pack the garlicky and spicy punch and it's the kind that doesn't leave you suffering for too long, which means you need thai chili and not jalapeno, which burns for way longer. and yes hippie thai does it right. 

did i just talk about one dish for two paragraphs? let's talk about another dish. tom yum noodle soup. there can be a variation. the variation they serve here is the clear soup kind, which i don't prefer but i'm ok with. and darn it is spicy but it doesn't kill you. it will cure your cold. not exactly curing it but you know you feel a bit relieved. i would ask for a bit less soup in the bowl. but that's just my preference. 

and i live just a few blocks from here. and the staff is super nice. we chat in thai about crazy people in the neighborhood. the decor reminds me of an old shophouse. the stainless steel cups? i was like yes... i haven't drunk from one of those since i was like 12. do they still make those anymore? and the stainless steel tall cups that hold utensils on the table? my grandma drank from that. where do you even buy those from nowadays? next time i will ask them and update on here because you all are DEFINITELY curious right? it's totally not just me. :)
author: Te R.

description: This place is the worst delivery I haven't had. They are not make delivered to my door had to come down to the street to get it and demanded big cash tips. The foods was terrible. I called back to complain about it. But seems like they were making fun of me. Do not call to to order delivery!!!
author: Apple A.

description: This place is amazing! So flavorful and all of the entrees are reasonably priced. Also, the food came out really fast and the staff are really great. To go and eat in is offered. The place is a bit small and not big for big groups, but it's the Haight, there's really nowhere to eat with a large group in the Haight. Eat here...seriously.
author: Mia C.

description:
Great Thai food! Very authentic! Love it :)
Pad see ew and beef noodle are yummy!
Try those!
author: Patrick S.

description: Had dinner tonight with my wife ... chicken satay was hard ... phad thai noodles was just horrible ... asked for hot sauce... i was told that there was an additional charge ... WHAT ! ... our lady server was so very rude maybe was having a bad hair day ... the guy at the counter was giving us the dagger/gangster look ... we just paid and left the food ... such a horrible place ... never have experienced such a bad attitude ... JUST A HORRIBLE EXPERIENCE.
author: Suresh V.

description: Could never pass up a sign that says hippie thai street food and vegetarian. Was actually across the street at another restaurant with pals, and came over here instead. Happy I did. I got fresh spring rolls which were HUGE and served with both peanut sauce and thai chili sauce. I also ordered the pumpkin curry, which was super delicious. It came with a huge portion of rice and the curry dish itself was a big size too. Loaded with pumpkin and veggies and just the perfect amount of heat that I asked for. Every bite was awesome. I took mine to go but the service was fast and friendly. Would definitely come here again if I was in the area!
author: Erica S.

description: In regards to Hippie Thai Street, the food could be good or below average. Last time I went the red curry had almost no taste, no spice, no salt. Very weird. The biggest issue we had was the service. The waitress looked annoyed and angry. No smile, no help, Nothing. I do not recommend to anybody to eat there.
author: D. R.

description:
I love the new makeover! The old place had an inch of grease all over everything.

Been here a couple times so far. This time I had pad see ew chicken and egg rolls. Last time I got Pad-thai and the moo ping pork skewers with sticky rice. Love the sauce that comes with the pork sticks. Yum!
author: William B.

description: Not good. This place didn't just change their name. I liked this spot because it was simple Thai...nothing fancy. But we tried Hippie Thai, and the food was really bad. It was either greasy, underseasoned or too spicy. The fried egg rolls was the only decent thing we ordered . I couldn't eat the good, so I gave it away to a homeless couple. Really...don't waste your time or money.
author: gretchen p.

description: Noodles were great but just seems like they're not trying very hard. Bland dish, disturbing portion size. You can't make up for quality with quantity!
author: Ian J.

description: Excellent Thai food for a very reasonable price. The ambiance is not great but tolerable and definitely not stale.  Recommend for a casual meal.
author: Trey C.

description: I have gone here a couple times because of how close it is to me and how quickly they get the food out to you. However, I liked the old restaurant better, Best of Thai, which was recently replaced by Hippie Thai. Since the change, prices have gone up several dollars per dish and I personally don't find the food worth the cost. Best of Thai was my late night, cheap-but-big-portion place to go. Now, the food tastes the same to me, but they give you smaller dishes. Also, every time I come here, the pad kee mao noodles are clumped together so much, so there are thick bites of noodles that don't have very good flavor. I think it's time for me to give this place up.
author: Jen W.

description: I came here today order a noodle, the noodle suppose to come twitch fish ball but it didn't. And the waitress is so so rude. I wish the owner could fire her asap to help the business. I also with to leave zero star if I could. So poor service. Really disappointed
author: James F.

description: They don't honor their hours. Won't take takeout orders 25 minutes before closing. In general, this is a place you go only when you have no other options.
author: Potluck M.

description: Do not ever freaking eat here!  I got food poisoning here and have been miserable!  One of the worst pains I've ever experienced and this place was the only thing I ate that day. Save yourself the consistent diarrhea and vomiting and chose another place!  -You're welcome.
author: Theonlysg69 ..

description: I've eaten at this place 3x. It's not the best Thai I've had, but it's also not the worst. The prices are OK, the portions are decent as well. It's a tiny bit better (quality wise) than Best of Thai Noodle that used to be in the same location, but the difference is so small that I doesn't merit another star.
author: Jonah K.

description:
"Sorry the kitchen closes at 10:15"

Really? Then why advertise that you're open until 11?

You can close anytime you want, just be transparent about it and don't waste our time.
author: Douglas C.

description: I work on Haight and I ordered lunch today from "Hippie Thai"for the first time and it turned out to be frighteningly bad. I ordered vegetarian Rad Nah with tofu. It is on their menu under "stir fried rice and noodles"described as "Stir fried flat rice noodles, choice of meat, with Chinese broccoli, topped with soybean gravy sauce"so I expected a pan fried rice noodles like pad see ew. what I got was a box of wide noodles that were stir fried and really oily and a huge container of what seemed to be 1 and a half cups of water with a half cup of oil and some cornstarch with some vegetables and tofu. I was confused by what I got because I didn't order soup. I called them to confirm my order and the  guy on the phone said that it was the right order and that way because it was vegetarian...I gave it a try. It tasted beyond bland, the texture of the goopy greasy sauce was unpleasant. I brought leftovers home thinking I could drain most of the sauce and add siracha for dinner,when I opened it again later it had separated into pools of oil and water. So gross!! No amount of hot sauce and draining could save it. My friend liked her food but I don't think I will be recommending this place to my customers.
author: Leann W.

description:
The BF and I were looking for a quick bite while touring Haight & Ashbury! You can never go wrong with Thai! This place was a hole in the wall, small restaurant serving pretty decent stuff! And you know it's good when the cook is Thai also! 

Good portions and strong flavor! We were attracted by the name and left liking the food too!
author: Tee A.

description: Delicious! I got the Thai iced tea and pad Thai and  really enjoyed both! Not the most amazing pad Thai I've ever had but it was good
author: Jasmin R.

description: I don't think this is the first time I've been here. However, it was the first since they changed the name and decor. I can't get over how good the water was. It may have been the silver drinking cups, or it may have been that I was hungover/dehydrated from partying the night before. Either way, so good. I ordered the yellow curry (vegan) and a side of rice noodles, it was delicious. We also got the fried roll appetizer, also very good. My friends were pretty stoked on their dishes as well. Although.. Lori asked for spicy and I think they may have opened the gates of hell to pick the peppers they added. She said it was good but nearly too spicy to eat. Be weary if you order is spicy, you may get what you ask for.
author: Jessica W.

description: Don't let the name fool you. This place is really good. Probably the freshest, best Thai I've had in the city. I've been a resident of San Francisco for 8 years and this is the best Thai I've ever had.
author: Matt G.

description: A vast improvement over Best of Thai, where I've been eating for years. The beef in the Pad Kee Mao is first rate, and the pork skewers are awesome. The Pad Thai is improved, as well.
author: V. M.

description:
Decided to write a review after my second visit. As of now I've had 2 dishes: the Pad Thai and the Pumpkin Curry. Overall it's been a middle of the road experience. The flavors are on point, but the one criticism of the food I have is that both times the chicken was tough and dry.

As for the service, it was ok. Not the fastest but they were busy and they're just starting out. One big note is that the small metal water cups, while interesting, aren't ideal. They don't hold very much water and the waitresses can't see through them from a distance to see if people are empty. I didn't get one refill the entire meal.

Easily correctable issues overall. The place can flourish with a few small tweaks. I'll give it another chance in a few weeks...so if management is looking I'll be happy to revise :)
author: Michael B.

description:
Since the rebranding from Best of Thai, it seems to go downhill fast.  Less selections of food, same taste except portions seem smaller and prices are an average $2 more. Many of the rice plates are gone and rice is extra.  A few of the dishes that now include rice isn't under $10. 

Water is served in a tiny tin cup compared to full sized glass.

**UPDATE --

So far, their specialty here seems to be soups because they do it extremely well and perhaps the best if not one of the best I've ever had. Example, the Tom Yum with various seafood and meats is absolutely astounding! This is the reason for a star increase.
author: Drake D.

description: Solid place for quick Thai food.  Tasty and big portions.  Love the Tom Yum soup.
author: Kevin C.

description: We were so disappointed the prices isn't reasonable, we were orders for 1 combo (Pinto come with 4 containers $15) they said if you comes for two people they will charge $15 per each and then we were ok with that, we got Pad Thai, Green chicken curry(we found only 6 pieces of chicken in curry), stream mix vegetables, and stream rice (that should not be an entree, it should be in addition) somehow, we thought we will get more big containers or more quantities but that was not different at all and it so ridiculous!!!! The service was ok.... But would never come back!
author: Akkachai P.

description:
Last night we ordered food to go for the first time from the re-branded and under new management restaurant. We live about 1-1/2 blocks away, so having this as a resource for those evenings when we don't have much time to prepare dinner is great. I needed to pick up a few things at Gus's first, and the food was ready to go by the time I finished with my shopping there.

Our order consisted of Pad Thai, Pad Kee Mao, and Gai Satay. Each dish was very tasty, with wonderful flavor balance, not muted at all. We are definitely adding it into our mix of places to get take (and eat out too) for our family. Kudos to the new owners!
author: Skip P.

description: Incredible spot! Get the panang curry and ground chicken with rice - amazing flavors! Our new go-to for an affordable dinner or takeout.
author: Taylor M.

description: Very good improvement from the place before. I go to Thailand often and my girlfriend is Thai, also I am a vegetarian. This place offers great authentic Thai food cooked exactly how you specify it (i.e. No fish sauce, extra crispy etc). I just wish they were open a little later.
author: Peter B.

description: This place is so delicious, great service and they can make almost any dish vegan!! hippie Thai is the go too
author: Campbell R.

description: Initially, the service was a bit off-putting. However after a seating issue was addressed, the service was genuinely pleasant and prompt. The basil chicken, ka ree puff, and wings were pretty good. It seems like they are more authentic and people are expecting more American Thai. I was surprised that the chicken was ground. Yet, it still had a nice authentic flavor without trying to overpower with spice.
author: A R.

description: Horrible food. Rice was hard and dry. Meat was stringy and dry. I recommend avoiding this place and going to any of the other Thai places on haight.
author: matt m.

description: My boyfriend and I ate here on vacation. We eat thai food a lot and LOVED the food here! The rice was done well, the curry had a perfect balance of paste-to-coconut-milk, and prices were great! We ordered a lunch special of pad-kee-moe with fried tofu and salad. The salad was just a romaine mix and close to the dish on the plate, but the dish was too good to care :). We also got the red curry with pumpkin which was done to perfect tenderness. One waiter was working the entire seating area and working hard! Unfortunately it took a little time to get his attention to get water and forks/napkins.
author: Lauren E.

description: I happened upon this place at "Happy Hour" and went in for a beer, however, the food looked so good, I ordered the calamari appetizer which came with a slaw like salad.  I think I have pretty high standards and I thought the calamari was crisp, tender, and non greasy. I loved sitting with a view of trees blowing in the wind on Haight St.  Not sure about the negative reviews.  Was planning returning with a friend for a complete meal.  Hope I'm not disappointed.
author: Linda Z.

description: Love the banana fried ice cream and panang curry with pad see ew noodles!! Super sweet staff and is open on the late side compared to the other Thai restaurants on upper Haight.
author: Marla M.

description: I ordered the Pad Thai with tofu and mixed vegetables to go. I was extremely disappointed to find there wasn't a single piece of tofu and only one piece of broccoli. The customer service here is horrible. I will not be returning
author: Anashea T.

description: If you like Thai food roulette you'll love this place. Order the same thing more than once and you'll get a different version every single time. I get home late some nights and unfortunately it's one of the only places open late on Haight St. Being a creature of habit and loving pork belly I usually order the #51, the pork belly with Chinese broccoli and rice. Ordering this has turned into my once a week game night as the possibilities really are endless. Tonights version was another surprise with the absence of any real pork. Thats's right, a pork belly dish with so little pork I had to search through the forest of Chinese broccoli and an Everest portion of steaming white rice to find it. There was so little pork that if I actually ordered something different for once I would've forgotten what it was. Past pork belly dishes have had so much chili added to it that I couldn't eat it. And no, chili isn't mentioned in the menu description. I've been given every other piece of the magical animal but for the belly, cooked three different ways. I've gotten pork sausage, BBQ pork and roast pork in herbs. I have to admit, that last one was good but it's not what I ordered. I'll chalk that one up to broadening my thai food horizons. I cant wait to see what I get next time. If I ever go back.
author: Adam F.
